ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] How are people getting the white scales?
ygData.msgSnippet: I cant wait for the day when I am in a guild big enough and brave/stupid enough to try new things and do some really fun stuff like this.  I envy some of these
ygData.messageBody:
I cant wait for the day when I am in a guild big enough and brave/stupid
enough to try new things and do some really fun stuff like this. I envy
some of these guilds, one day I hope.

Mu

-----Original Message-----
From: Cranfill, Wendy [mailto:Wendy_Cranfill@...]
Sent: Friday, May 25, 2001 10:26 AM
To: 'eqbards@yahoogroups.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] How are people getting the white scales?


Hahahaha I makes jokes about having my thumb up my butt all the time ROFL,
its a guild joke now.
Leadership is very interesting, I have to first agree that if people dont
listen, thats the end of the raid right there. But also, often leaders
aren't clear or get some bug up their butts and end up wasting our time and
theirs because they "know better." Our old raid leader was absolutely the
worst about this, he knew everything, and although we were successful, he
claimed all success as his. And still does, even when he's gone.

Paradigm does pretty well overall I'd say, but one of the things that
strikes me as hugely amusing is when people in other guilds say "I want to
be in PD, I'm tired of all this dying!" I just laugh and ask them how many
times they think we died to Yelinak before we killed him, or Dain, or omg
let's not even talk about Trak. Raids fail all the time and I think its the
mark or a good group or guild to have the perseverence to keep trying until
they get it right.

Ok need coffee, think I'm sounding preachy sorry :P

Halana 60th Shammy
Tani 52nd Bardette
Solusek Ro

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Matt DeBarger [mailto:mattdeba@...]
> Sent: Friday, May 25, 2001 7:02 AM
> To: eqbards@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] How are people getting the white scales?
>
>
> Leadership means nothing when the people there don't listen
> to commands.
> Maybe Veeshan is the exception in this case, but I have seen
> the leader of
> one of our most powerful guilds fail on a Vox run due to complete
> incompetence of the people there. If people had at all been
> able to follow
> directions, I wouldn't be sitting around with my thumb up my
> butt waiting
> for my guild to get enough resist gear to down Gone. (I have
> pretty much
> everything else done). Bitter?
>
> Elfson Allegro 55 Veeshan
